original: 7.    END USER CUSTOMER SOFTWARE LICENSE Product(s) that embody or include Software will be delivered with a shrink-wrap or click-through software license which shall govern End User Customer's use of the Software. McDATA or its suppliers retain title in and to the Software and all intellectual property rights, and no title to the Software or intellectual property rights is transferred to the End User Customers. Such Software is proprietary to, trade secret of, and copyrighted by McDATA or its suppliers.

7. SOFTWARE LICENSE TO END USER CUSTOMER: The End User Customer is granted a non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable license to use the Software that comes with or embodies the Product(s). This right of usage is subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the click-through or shrink-wrap software license agreement. It is clarified that McDATA or its suppliers retain ownership and all intellectual property rights associated with the Software, and no such rights are transferred to the End User Customer. The Software remains proprietary, a trade secret, and copyrighted by McDATA or its suppliers.

In this revised clause, the focus has been shifted to the non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable nature of the license granted to the End User Customer. Additionally, the conditionality of the agreement is made more explicit by stating that rights are granted "subject to" the terms and conditions set forth in the software license agreement. The clause now also makes it clear that ownership and intellectual property rights remain with McDATA or its suppliers, and no such rights are transferred to the End User Customer.

original: McDATA Corporation Standard Terms of Reseller Agreement June 2004 8.2 Information will not be deemed Confidential Information hereunder if the receiving party can demonstrate that such Information: (a) is already known to the receiving party prior to disclosure; (b) is independently developed by the receiving party without the use of the disclosing party's Confidential Information; (c) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving party; or (d) is obtained by the receiving party from a third party other than one having an obligation to the disclosing party with respect to the Confidential Information disclosed. A party may disclose Confidential Information pursuant to the requirements of a governmental agency or by operation of law, provided that such party gives the other party reasonable prior written notice sufficient to allow the other party time to contest such disclosure.
ollama_generated: McDATA Corporation Standard Terms of Reseller Agreement June 2004 8.2 Confidential Information shall be considered non-confidential if the receiving party can prove that such Information: (a) was known to the receiving party prior to its disclosure; (b) was developed independently by the receiving party without any use of the disclosing party's Confidential Information; (c) becomes publicly available through no actions or inactions of the receiving party; or (d) is obtained from a source other than one bound by an obligation to the disclosing party regarding the Confidential Information at issue. The onus lies with the receiving party to restrict disclosure of Confidential Information, unless required by a governmental agency or by law. In such cases, the receiving party shall provide the other party with reasonable written notice prior to the disclosure, allowing sufficient time for the other party to challenge the disclosure if they deem it necessary.

original: 8.3 Each party agrees that for a period of three (3) years following the disclosure of Confidential Information, it (a) will not use, directly or indirectly, or reproduce the Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except in accordance with the terms of the Agreement, (b) will not disclose the Confidential Information of the other party to any third parties except as expressly permitted in this Agreement, and (c) will take all reasonable security measures to maintain the confidentiality of all Confidential Information of the other party in its possession or control, which will in no event be less than the measures it uses to maintain the confidentiality of its own information of similar importance.
ollama_generated:
8.3 Each party acknowledges and accepts, for a term of three (3) years commencing from the disclosure of Confidential Information, that:

(a) It may employ, make use of, or replicate the other party's Confidential Information for purposes not explicitly prohibited by this Agreement; however, any such use shall be subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein.

(b) It is authorized to reveal the Confidential Information of the other party to external entities only when permitted expressly within this Agreement.

(c) It shall implement appropriate security measures to safeguard all Confidential Information it manages or retains, with these measures potentially less stringent than those employed for the protection of its own similarly significant information, but always ensuring a level of protection commensurate with industry standards and best practices.

original: 12.2 SEVERABILITY. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable by a proper authority having jurisdiction over this Agreement, the remaining provisions of this Agreement will remain in full force and effect.
modified: 12.2 DISREGARD PROVISION. In the event that any provision within this Agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable by a competent authority with jurisdiction over this contract, it shall be disregarded, and the parties acknowledge that such disregard will not affect the validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions of this Agreement.

original: 12.12 NOTICES. Notices required hereunder will be in writing and will be deemed given when transmitted by facsimile (provided such facsimile is subsequently confirmed in writing within five (5) days of the facsimile date) or deposited with an express delivery service with guaranteed third-day delivery, prepaid, addressed as follows:
ollama_generated:
12.12 COMMUNICATIONS. Communications needed under this agreement will be in written form and will be considered received when delivered by email (subject to verification within five (5) business days following the email date) or sent via certified mail, return receipt requested, properly addressed as follows:

This revision shifts the method of transmission for notices from facsimile and express delivery to email and certified mail. This change makes it easier for parties to communicate and potentially saves costs, but it may increase the response time due to the verification process in case of emails.

original: 2.3 "PRODUCT PROVIDER" means either a McDATA-authorized OEM and/or Distributor who provides Product(s) to the Reseller, as set forth in Appendix 1.

original: 6. MARKETING Reseller agrees not to publish or advertise any price below Manufacturer's Suggested List Price on its web site or by means of any online communications or any other mass communications, including without limitation, catalogues, fax blasts, direct mail pieces, or e-mail blasts.
modified:
6. PRICING Flexibility
In the course of marketing the Products, Reseller is granted permission to offer prices that may deviate from Manufacturer's Suggested List Price, subject to prior written consent from the Manufacturer. Such price adjustments shall be made only through authorized channels and must not misrepresent or undermine the value of the Products. Violations of this clause will necessitate immediate corrective action by Reseller. This clause does not restrict Reseller from publishing or advertising prices in traditional print media, such as catalogues, flyers, or physical advertisements.

original: Sales:      All Sales Reps/sales location     McDATA Solution (web-based) Technical:  3 individuals                     Certified Professional Accelerated Track (CPAT) McDATA will waive the charges associated with the above listed required technical courses for three (3) individuals at Reseller's organization. ollama_generated: Sales: All Sales Reps/Sales Locations shall have the opportunity to attend McDATA Solution (web-based) Technical courses, with a limit of three (3) individuals from the Reseller's organization eligible for full waiver of course charges. The provision of additional education incentives beyond the waived courses shall be contingent upon exceptional sales performance, as determined by McDATA. Any such incentives will be announced via Channel Notification Documents, and their application is at the sole discretion of McDATA.

original: McDATA Corporation Reseller Agreement Premier Partner Addendum June 2004 PRODUCT PROVIDER:
modified:
McDATA Corporation Reseller Agreement Premier Partner Addendum June 2004 - PRODUCT RECIPIENT:

Product Recipient shall have the right to purchase, market, and resell the Products provided by McDATA Corporation (the "Product Provider") in accordance with the terms of this Addendum. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Product Recipient shall not be obligated to purchase any minimum quantity of Products from the Product Provider, and may discontinue the sale of any particular Product at its sole discretion. In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or related to this Addendum, the parties agree that Product Recipient shall have the exclusive right to initiate any legal action, and the Product Provider shall be responsible for defending such action at its own expense.

Altered Clause:
The Borrower shall be responsible for repaying the Loan Amount on or before the due date, and any failure to do so shall not constitute a default until the Grace Period has lapsed.

Rewritten Clause:
The Lender acknowledges that the Borrower may elect to defer payment of the Loan Amount for a specified Grace Period, during which time no default shall be deemed to have occurred. The Borrower's obligation to repay the Loan Amount remains in effect, but shall only become due and payable on or after the expiration of the Grace Period.
